content.raw:
Does it make sense for a query to have entities but no components?

I imagine the answer is that it doesn't matter? If I understand correctly, the query class itself doesn't care about the connection between components and entities and doesn't provide any mechanisms to prevent it being misused, correct?
content.html:
Does it make sense for a query to have entities but no components?

I imagine the answer is that it doesn't matter? If I understand correctly, the query class itself doesn't care about the connection between components and entities and doesn't provide any mechanisms to prevent it being misused, correct?

content.raw: Yeah, that’s currently the situation. I could add logic to prevent the addition of an entity if there are no components, but…meh.
content.html: Yeah, that’s currently the situation. I could add logic to prevent the addition of an entity if there are no components, but…meh.

content.raw: Doesn't a component type need to inherit from `ComponentType`? So in that case, `ComponentTypeId` would represent `PoseComponentType` instead of `ignition::math::Pose3d`?
content.html: Doesn't a component type need to inherit from ComponentType? So in that case, ComponentTypeId would represent PoseComponentType instead of ignition::math::Pose3d?

content.html: Good point. I removed the ComponentType class: 2c2f6a8

content.raw: `Run` can be called more than once, right? In that case, I don't think we want to reinitialize the systems, or do we?
content.html: Run can be called more than once, right? In that case, I don't think we want to reinitialize the systems, or do we?

content.raw: Thanks. I moved this functionality to a new function: [59b3d6d](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/commits/59b3d6d929b558de21a9bad51c2ab39f3b7f4037?at=default). I also added parallel system initialization and update.
content.html: Thanks. I moved this functionality to a new function: 59b3d6d. I also added parallel system initialization and update.

content.raw:
Should this use `this->entityQueryRegistrar` instead of creating a new registrar for each system?

Also, the way this is setup right now, I don't understand what's the point of the registrar if it will just be a temporary object populated by the system to hold the callbacks until they're moved to `SystemInternal`.
content.html:
Should this use this->entityQueryRegistrar instead of creating a new registrar for each system?

Also, the way this is setup right now, I don't understand what's the point of the registrar if it will just be a temporary object populated by the system to hold the callbacks until they're moved to SystemInternal.

content.raw: Keeping it a local instance will allow us to initialize systems in parallel, and the registrar doesn’t need to last the lifetime of the server. Constructing this multiple times is fine since it’s a lightweight object and Init occurs only once at startup. The registrar class allows us to extend the functionality of registration without changing the signature of the System::Init.
content.html: Keeping it a local instance will allow us to initialize systems in parallel, and the registrar doesn’t need to last the lifetime of the server. Constructing this multiple times is fine since it’s a lightweight object and Init occurs only once at startup. The registrar class allows us to extend the functionality of registration without changing the signature of the System::Init.

content.raw: Ok I see, it makes sense.
content.html: Ok I see, it makes sense.

content.raw: Why is this being removed? Not useful?
content.html: Why is this being removed? Not useful?

content.raw: It was not used, so I removed it.
content.html: It was not used, so I removed it.

content.raw: Is this valid usage of a system? I'd expect it to be an abstract class. Do you think it makes sense to make `System::Init` pure virtual? I think a system would be useless unless it implements it?
content.html: Is this valid usage of a system? I'd expect it to be an abstract class. Do you think it makes sense to make System::Init pure virtual? I think a system would be useless unless it implements it?

content.raw:
Yes, this is valid in that it doesn't break anything but also doesn't do any meaningful. If someone wants to do this, then more power to them. 

A system doesn't have to implement `Init`, that function is optional.
content.html:
Yes, this is valid in that it doesn't break anything but also doesn't do any meaningful. If someone wants to do this, then more power to them.

A system doesn't have to implement Init, that function is optional.

content.raw: Ok I see. I just thought that making the function pure virtual would be a good signal to developers that they must implement that function for the system to work.
content.html: Ok I see. I just thought that making the function pure virtual would be a good signal to developers that they must implement that function for the system to work.

content.raw:
A system does not have to implement `Init` in order to do something useful. For example, a system could require no entities. Instead it could listen to data coming from a topic, and perform some computation on that data.

I was striving for fewer mandates by the API.
content.html:
A system does not have to implement Init in order to do something useful. For example, a system could require no entities. Instead it could listen to data coming from a topic, and perform some computation on that data.

I was striving for fewer mandates by the API.

content.raw: Ok I see where you're coming from. It was just my understanding that if you wanted to do something other than manipulate entities, you wouldn't be using a system.
content.html: Ok I see where you're coming from. It was just my understanding that if you wanted to do something other than manipulate entities, you wouldn't be using a system.

content.raw: I know this is just an example, but wouldn't it be simpler to just use `ignition::math::Pose3d` as the component or is that not allowed?
content.html: I know this is just an example, but wouldn't it be simpler to just use ignition::math::Pose3d as the component or is that not allowed?
